content.question: Which of the following scenarios is an example of a therapist using rational-emotive behavior therapy?

choices.label: Stanley thinks he is never going to get a job, so his therapist says that would be the worst thing that could ever happen to Stanley.
Maya is afraid of riding in elevators, so her therapist makes her ride on elevators to get over her fear.
Meyla is misbehaving in school, so her therapist makes a chart that allows Meyla to receive a star every time she is well behaved.
Jose is grounded for a month and keeps misbehaving, so his therapist explains to Jose's mother that it may be helpful to have Jose do chores to reduce the time he is grounded.

content.answer: Stanley thinks he is never going to get a job, so his therapist says that would be the worst thing that could ever happen to Stanley.

skill.text: 1.A: Apply psychological perspectives, theories, concepts, and research findings to a scenario.
